petNameAdd:
1) State Of Assam
    Advocate - Tapan Kumar Bhattacharya

business_details.Business: Today the case is fixed for hearing of the accused on the point of sentence. Convicted accused Durjan Mallah is produced from jail hajot. Accused Durjan Mallah is convicted u/s 8 of POCSO Act. Accordingly I have heard Ld. defence counsel as well as Ld. Addl. P.P. for the State on the point of sentence. I have heard accused person on the point of sentence and same is written in a separate sheet and tagged with record. After hearing accused on the point of sentence, hearing counsel and considering the nature of the offence and facts and circumstances, convicted accused Durjan Mallah is sentenced to undergo rigorous imprisonment of 3 years and 10 months R.I and to pay fine of Rs 10,000/- i/d another 6 months R.I. u/s 8 of the POCSO Act. Bail bond of accused Durjan Mallah stands cancelled. Surety discharged. Period under detention is set off u/s 428 Cr.P.C. Let furnish free copy of Judgment to convicted accused Durjan. The convicted accused person is told that he has right to appeal against the judgment and order of this court before Hon&amp#039ble High court through the jail authority or independently of his own. Convicted accused is further informed that he is entitled free legal aid to prefer appeal before the Hon&amp#039ble High court. Send copy of judgment to learned District Magistrate Dhubri u/s 365 Cr.P.C.Case is disposed of.
